snippet: The two-year, $37.6 billion plan — which expands gambling and preserves aid to municipalities — has drawn criticism for its reliance on one-time revenue sources.
abstract: Connecticut legislators pass two-year, $37.6 billion budget that includes a large expansion of gambling and reflects the degree to which Connecticut faces continuing financial budget distress despite passing a record $1.5 billion tax increase in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The two-year, $37.6 billion plan — which expands gambling and preserves aid to municipalities — has drawn criticism for its reliance on one-time revenue sources.
